reviews.text: Excellent Indian restaurant. Been going here for many years and it has never disappointed. Quality is consistently good. The staff are polite and attentive. Comfortable and attractive surroundings when dining in. Best in the area IMHO.

This restaurant has been here as long as I can remember and consistently delivers.  This is one of the few restaurants where our picky pre-teens will try and actually enjoy some of the food, so it is in the family meal rotation.  The only complaint we've ever had was occasionally undercooked samosas, but the bread and meals have always been delicious.

Ordered first time from this place. very bad experience! Ordered chicken masala got tomato soup with big chunks of tomatoes and some bland chicken thigh pieces. Sugary store bought gravy. No such spice to taste. Very pricey at the same time. No going back!

This restaurant is AMAZING! The quality of service is exceptional and the workers are very friendly. The price of the food is great compared to the serving amount and the food is absolutely delicious.

I was lucky enough to be in the area for business and our senior leader hosted a dinner at Haandi Indian Cuisine.  The staff was impeccable, every detail was attended to, and the food was easily the best Indian food I have had to date.  I live in an area with many Indian restaurants as we enjoy a healthy and growing Indian population and I will keep trying at home to find anything close to this cuisine.  Thanks to all at Haandi for a memorable experience and culinary delight.

name: Starbucks
vicinity: 7501 Leesburg Pike Idylwood, Plaza, Falls Church

reviews.text: This location MADE MY DAY! After a warm greeting, and a personal compliment (on my sunflower earrings) the staff completed my order quickly and with quality. Thank you to the excellent service and unbridled kindness that you gave me today- including the cute sunflower drawing!

This store always messes up my mobile order. On Nov 11 I ordered a hot drink but when I picked it up, it was made as a cold drink. The manager fixed the situation. On Nov 13, I ordered a mobile drink and waited and waited until I was asked if I needed helped. I told the worker I was waiting for my mobile order drink. Estimate time was 9:09 am. At 9:15 am was when I was asked if I was waiting for an order. I said yes. And told them my drink and name. The worker accused me of lying about my order so i showed my mobile Starbucks app order history to confirm my order. Then the work made my drink. She didn’t apologize for the delay or accusing me of lying.
I waited for too long there was only one person making the drinks and the cashier. My drink didn’t taste good and I asked for 2 shots of espresso but it didn’t seem like I got it.

We came in, in the evening and everyone was very pleasant and helpful.
It's just like every other Starbucks and really, when you go there that's what you're looking for.
I ordered an iced coffee ahead i waited for over 20 mnts and i didn’t eve  get my drink or my money back this is the second time that this has happened at this store

Great for kids. Full disclosure: we ordered from the only for their kids options to have something easy to order. Their kids portions are generous and comes with broccoli which was a hit. Kids like the Bolognese spaghetti, the Mac 'n cheese looked like Kraft dinner out of the box. Their pizza is well done and generous on garnish as advertised: every square cut had a full thick pepperoni slice on it. Would definitely order from there again. The order was ready on the pick up wall as scheduled (25 min to prep as advertised)

Ledos is my second choice for pizza as I prefer NY style. But for it's type it is great.
A bit thinner and sweeter crust than most. Far better than the national chains.

Love the pizza and the wings - always cooked perfectly and consistently great tasting.  Only issue was with pick up - the salad was put in the same bag with the wings, so was warm by the time I got home. Too bad, because I love Ledo's Italian salad - the house dressing is the best.

Falls Church restaurant has serious customer service issues. I was very excited to treat my guests with LEDO pizza. Unfortunately, I couldn't enjoy it because the restaurant manager, who assisted me, was unfriendly and impatient. She raised her voice when I asked if they had a no-ham pizza for my friends. "Built your own pizza!" - she repeatedly responded in an aggressive manner. Her approach towards paying customer made me feel uncomfortable and unwelcome.
When placing a $114 order at the LEDO location, I expected to be treated nicely and friendly following LEDO pizza's high standards, and Instead, I got the worst customer service in my life. According to your website, 'the concept is to provide high-quality food at a great value in a comfortable, family atmosphere," and it feels nothing like this in the Falls Church location. Other employees I spoke to, both the host and the cook, were friendly and welcoming. In this context, it's been even more shocking to see a hostile manager's approach toward your loyal paying customer.
Enjoyed watching the NFL games on Sunday. The wings were great and the pizza is pretty good. Not a fan of carpet wall to wall in the bar. Just sayin

Extensive outdoor seating on large, regal wooden picnic tables with heat lamps built in, for the winter, and huge Mediterranean-style yellow umbrellas to block the sun, in the summer. The whole plaza has deluxe seating. // Thanks Federal Realty Trust.

I was always impressed how this Starbucks always had it together, and with app orders ready when they say they will be. The manager with the ponytail- Dave I think? Is always so friendly and helpful. But if he isn’t there that day, this place seems to be a mess. The last several mornings (over a few weeks) I’ve ordered my coffee and breakfast sandwich well in advance, they have not had the sandwich ready for more than 10 mins past the estimated time ready. A few minutes, okay, more than 10- now I’m late for work. The baristas seem super flustered and making excuses that someone’s not there, or they’re really busy. Instead of wait, I asked for a refund of the missing item. The first time they didn’t know how to do that, but luckily today they took care of it promptly. I will be more hesitant about ordering from this location in the morning moving forward.
This Starbucks is a really positive experience! I came in for breakfast after grocery shopping and the barista was so nice and thanked me for coming with a smile. Made me feel welcome!

While this coffee shop always has Pupachinos, much of the time it does NOT have all of its' items for people.

Specifically, the bacon gouda sandwich is seldom available after 9:15AM

Otherwise, a decent coffee shop, with fast service.

Why ask someone their name for their order if you're not going to put it in correctly? They were busy and backed up not to mention they called someone else's name on my coffee. Yeah though it sat there for about 5 minutes until everyone else cleared out. And only figured out that they didn't get my name correct which is very simple....Alex. Not Adam.  Apparently somehow it is my fault because they didn't seem very concerned. Definitely not using this location anymore.

Lovely building, a tad small, but who dines in anyway? I thought it was a little odd to get a new cup for refills, but I guess that lowers the cross contamination, so yay them! Food is still delicious, just feel bad for all small businesses
Very bad customer service. I had a in app reward and was not able to use it and I was made to wait 15 mins when the cashier kept calling someone and checking details. Not pleasant experience.

This place fills up the neighborhood’s mailbox with coupons to attract customers, when you show up, you are told the owner doesn’t accept coupons and that the owner is full awarded coupons are being distributed in the neighborhood. This is called fish and bait and is illegal. Never eating a subway again, especially at this subway.

Skinny Indian guy was very rude. He gave me misinformation about the product and when I asked him again he was literally screaming at me saying “THATS WHAT I’M TELLING YOU”. Very bad customer service and I will never go there again.
Best subway I’ve been at for many years. Clean, fast, and service makes it good

I ordered two medium pizza for pick up on Saturday, July 16 at 2 o’clock. The first one I ordered banana pepper and ground beef and the second one I asked for jalapeño and chicken when I went there I pick up my order I came home both of them were banana pepper so I called the store and Talked to a guy who was very rude and he told me that I’m lying I just want to get a free pizza here I’m gonna download the picture of that pizza so that this rude guy to see everybody not like him nobody lie for getting five dollars pizza for free

I'm leaving this as a warning to make sure you check your credit card or bank receipts.  I was updating my budget and discovered that these guys added three dollars to my last bill with no notice.  I'm staring both at the email I was given after placing my order, as well as the credit card charge and there's a $3 difference.  I always pick up my food so there was no delivery charge or anything.  May have been an honest mistake, or they may have someone there skimming.  Food has always been well made, so I'll give them three stars.

I hate to leave a poor review, but service at this location has consistently been going downhill and my last experience was my last straw. I placed an online order for carryout for a pizza with 3 toppings. I came in to pick it up and it took a minute, but they handed me my box. I went out to my car, but thought to check the box and it was a plain cheese pizza. I went back in to see if it was a screw up. They said sorry, and handed me a different box. I walked out to my car again, but thankfully checked again because it was a supreme pizza (not my toppings). I went back in and they looked around for 5 minutes then said they would have to remake it. I sat in the store for 30 minutes while they remade my pizza, with no urgency or sincere apology. When they finally gave me the pizza that I ordered, they said I could grab a drink on my way out...no other offer to make up for the disaster of a visit. I don't even drink soda, so that offer was worthless. I place the online order for carry out so that I can run in and out in less than a minute. Now I have to find a more reliable Domino's or just a new pizza place all together. Such a bummer. I even reached out to Domino's HQ and they've been silent.

The worst ever. Bad unprofessional costumer service. I order 2 pizza one with no sauce because I have allergies. They put tomatoe sauce on both. I called them, I asked them to send me another with my correct order they refused. On top of that the guy kept screaming and hang up on me. Do not use their service. Look for other pizza stores. We paid over $60.

Delivery is the pits! We used to order every Friday night and get it delivered. Now, it takes forever and the orders have not been correct. Right now, I am waiting on a pizza that I ordered 1 hour ago. After finally getting someone on the phone, I was told that they were just making it. This is my LAST time ordering from them!,

My husband and I came here for the first time, the owner Hedi was absolutely delightful! The food was incredible and he suggested some of the best Riesling I have had in a while. I had the saffron risotto and lamb shank, and my husband had the salmon. The bread they bring out is baked fresh and hot, it’s so perfect!! Both were cooked incredibly! If you have not been here, I highly recommend it!! We will 100% be back! ❤️❤️
Great customer service. Wonderful ambiance and a cozy feel to this neighborhood restaurant. Food was pretty delicious--we especially liked the duck dish. Would come back again!

Big plates, super delicious meals (they have a large variety of seafood and also some veggie options) and super friendly staff. Big thank you for being very considerate of our religious restrictions. I would be even more delighted if the location is slightly different. The area is not the best.

Great food! Exactly what I wanted to have tonight - a lot of quality meat with vegetables and no carbs. Google reviews did not disappoint. I confirm - 4.8 stars is very accurate ratings for this place. They also seem to have good covid-19 precautions. Some tables are set up outside as well.
Lamb shank was $27 and portion was very generous.

The main course meats were really well done. The lamb shank was tender and had a good jus. The sea bass had a nice crispy skin. The sides with the meats were decent. The risotto with the lamb was more like a pilaf rather than creamy, which may have paired better than pilaf, and the peas and corn in both dishes was a bit odd. Our wine was good, and they have great deals now on wine. The key lime pie was also solid. Definitely a good spot in this hidden turning foodie strip mall with Taco Bamba.

The food was great, the portions are sharable, and the restaurant was clean!!! The cashier and the food delivery person was just rude! They didn't greet us when taking our order, and they just kept yelling out orders. They yelled an order out that sounded just like ours and the guy behind us so we went to get it and she got an attitude like we were trying to steal another order it sounded just like ours, but she said "Not yours you had this and this, this has this and this no onions!!! Okay, you didn't yell that part.....Needless to say getting a name for the orders or giving out numbers would be a better option rather than saying shrimp fried rice and chicken wings when 3 people just literally ordered the same thing! Then she gave us the wrong food after we opened up the bag to check we saw it was orange chicken not general tso's chicken we brought it to her attention she got an attitude like they don't make mistakes she looked herself and said oh hold on this is yours and this belongs here and just put it in another bag. I asked for soy sauce and got two, I just ordered two dishes I need a little more than two!!!

Good food, served hot, and friendly staff.

The food is very good and tasty consistently. Other Chinese restaurants might have meh food or just "generic food", but this restaurant cooks the food the way I like it, with that classic Chinese food restaurant taste from years ago. Much better than the current Panda Express.

Highly recommended!

Place is clean. Food is alright. Nothing special, so 4 star. I ordered fried dumplings, and they are not your typical dumplings. Very disappointed. They chose a easier way to make fried dumplings. See picture.

Called to order two lunch boxes for pickup.  Arrived 10 minutes later, two lunch boxes were ready and warmly made. However, although the Roasted Pork Fried Rice and the Roasted Pork Lo Mein were advertised as $6.95 each (see photo attached), we were charged $7.95 each! We were very unhappy about the price increase. The fried rice contained only about ten small dices of roasted pork. The lo mein contained around seven or eight thin strips of roasted pork.
Smail good loves you, don't talk if your mouth is full of food ' , food was not good. Making food with Ajinomoto only which is very bad for health. No any Chinese test in this restaurant.

Absolutely delicious, as it’s a typical Taco Bell with great proximity to Falls Church, to include the greater Washington DC metropolitan. I always find myself indulging more than I should, as tacos are simply amazing.

Standard fare for Mexican like fast food. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Establishment is clean. If you're on the go and hungry, a good place for a quick fix. Options to order:
A) App
B) Online
C) Phone (linked on website)
D) Send your spouse with a list😜

Dining in has the advantage of having access to extra sauce, napkins, plastic utensils, top off your beverage.

Recently moved nearby and this location is consistently great and the staff are always friendly.

Special mention to the guy working the drive-thru at 10:30pm on 1/14/23 who was exceptionally courteous when I was having trouble with my credit cards. I appreciated that!
This place was cool. The taste is good. The restaurant seats could be renovated because they look old the same as tables.

I have only once have I gotten an incorrect order here and when I came back around to let them know something was missing, they replaced it and have me a few taco coupon for the next time I came. Everyone is friendly and you're never waiting long.

We love this place and have been coming here for a while now.  Good burgers, good hot dogs (I'm partial to the Chicago Dog which, at just $5, is a steal around here), and great ice cream and shakes.  There is a lot of the essence of Falls Church in this place, which feels really homey in contrast to the McDonald's across the street.  We're glad it's ours to enjoy.

Great sandwiches at a great price. Perfect stop a few blocks off of w&od bike trail. Outdoor seating = bike friendly. Incredibly friendly and good service by the wait staff. Love the free refills of water and iced tea.

We got three different sandwiches to share and all were super delicious. We also got a brownie ice cream Sunday and it was  delicious. Deducted one star because we “upgraded” our side from chips to French fries and the server added an additional side which added almost $10 to our bill of food we didn’t get. We didn’t notice till we left or else we would have said something.
Ordered Chocolate brownie milkshake and Kit Kat shake. It was average. Very limited options for people eating only Chicken. Would love to try their breakfast sandwiches

Had a surprisingly wonderful meal at this place, in the middle of a downpour. I will admit the tent outside is starting to show it's wear & staff was just a little less than efficient, but the food & ice cream made up for any minor flaws.
The Brooklyn Bridge was just perfect, The Mustang was seasoned to perfection with a side of fries big enough for 2 to share. Topped off with some homemade ice cream that just wonderful.

The breakfast torta is absolutely amazing!

Every visit I've made to this location, the quality of the food is excellent. Always hot, fresh, and delicious.

The atmosphere here is unlike most other restaurants, it's a super chill vibe, and a great place to sit down and enjoy a satisfying meal.

Highly recommend. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Flat out some of the best tacos you will eat. Torta Bamba is comically large. Bamba fries are excellent. Every taco I've tried has been amazing.

Excellent (and big!) tacos plus lots of other good stuff such as horchata, elote etc. Busy place with limited counter space inside but out front there are several tables shaded by a roof with electric fans for cooling. Really good, will definitely be back.

I don't know why I didn't come sooner!! Taco Bamba is extremely popular here and it's easy to see why! Tacos, enchiladas, and quesadilla were all so good. Doesn't matter what you get, you will like them all

This place is a must if you love an authentic taco as well as a taco with a twist.  I ordered almost 1 of each type of taco😋 and have yet to be disappointed.  My favorites are the Black Pearl and the Camaron del Diablo.  And if you like horchata their version is sure to please. Great flavor of rice milk, sugar, and cinnamon.  They also have a variety of Jarritos soda flavors available if you like a little fizz.   There is a bar set up inside as well as a small area outside with seating or you may choose to carry your order away.
The Paneer Tikka masala was really good. We ordered Malai Chicken Kababs which was decent and the Chicken wings were okay. The Butter Naan was really soft.

I have nothing but good things to say about this restaurant and their authentic Indian cuisine. However if I could give this PLAZA where this restaurant is zero stars I would. Although the individual businesses are great and some of my favorites in the area, the management of this plaza has serious issues and has turned a blind eye to not only customer but business owner complaints. They have been supporting Pete’s towing company in unlawfully towing customer cars that are parked in the front lot. There are several contradictory signs in the lot and the towing operators target customers with no evidence. I myself parked and saw my car towed within 10 minutes of being at the retail plaza. I can only imagine that a property management company in cahoots with an unlawful and crooked towing company also practices bad business. This is not only disappointing as a customer but to the small business owner tenants who have to deal with irritated customers and the resulting negative impact on their businesses. BEWARE until this problem is resolved. I love supporting these businesses but think they deserve more respect than they are being shown as tenants

Decent Indian food. The samosas were delicious but very oily. The paneer tikka masala wasn’t great as the paneer wasn’t grilled. The dal & methi malai matar were quite good. The jeera rice was very ordinary. All in all a decent meal but I don’t think I will be visiting them anytime soon.

Overall the Buffet was very good. A very good selection of items. First time here to try the food and buffet. Service was good, folks are friendly. There was a good amount of people coming in for lunch. The place appears to be popular. The strip mall that the restaurant and other businesses sit in is in a weird location. This looks like an old location. Towing signs are all over with a tow truck sitting and waiting to tow people who go over the time limit. Looks like an hour is a limit. I will have to come back to try additional items.

Best Indian food in the DMV!

I have eaten at a lot of places and Saffron provides the best Indian food by far - especially at this cost!!

I love the chicken tiki masala - spicy Hott!

My family loves the butter chickens or lamb korma.

All of their dishes are prepared fresh and served quickly and HOT!

Bed sure to try them - you will not regret anything on this menu!

This restaurant is Your one-stop shop for burgers, fries, hotdogs, and more. This place was straight to the point, and the burgers were delicious. Friendly staff. I couldn't say more, but the food was filling. I'd come back to try more of their options!

Ordered 2 vegan burgers online through the Burger7 site and were given Halloumi (cheese) instead. When we called to get a refund we were told they could not because it was an online order. They said to get the vegan burger we should have done “build your own”. This place seems to have zero knowledge of food allergies and the ingredients in their products.
Asked for two chili and cheese hot dogs and they gave me two hot dogs with ground beef and a slice of American cheddar. Worst spot, can’t even get simple chili and cheese done.

Not exaggerating in the least, the worst Burger I've ever had my life. It was greasy, flavorless, small, and took 25 minutes to get to my table. The customer service was horrendous. And on top of all that, it made my stomach feel off for the rest of the day. Between its price, lack of quality, lack of customer service, and just general lack of appeal, I cannot see this place lasting for long. I certainly will not be returning and I recommend that anyone who wants a burger stay away from this place, unless you want to ruin your day.
I ordered spicy chicken burger it was good and all but it wasn’t even spicy + the fries aren’t fried enough. i liked the decoration tho :)

Great neighborhood spot that’s pet friendly with good outdoor seating. They have a nice beer selection. Something for everyone. I’m a wine drinker and I’ve been able to get decent reds.

As for food, what they make, they do well. I do have my go to, “sliders!” I can never decide if I want the beef or chicken so I get both.

Excellent food, the Spicy Chicken Sandwich is top notch, the Spicy Shrimp Po'Boy (limited time special) was phenomenal, the burger special was also good and the fries. Zero complaints about the food, 100 over 100 period.

Excellent beer on tap (24 choices) and in their bottle shop (can’t even count how many) and if you’re a wine person, they’ve got that too.

The staff always provide an excellent customer experience. Always checking in but not making it seem like their trying to rush you out. When you ask, they give you great recommendations, both food and beer wise.

If it says anything, the wife and I have been there three times in two months and in the National Capital Area it’s a 30-45 minute drive one way when we have other choices here and around Leesburg.

Keep up the great job Dominion and we’ll be back again soon.

The best beer bar in Northern Virginia, hands down. Expansive, well-curated tap list, excellent food and a helpful, knowledgeable, friendly staff. Never a bad experience. And, on top of all that, they have a bottle shop downstairs, so you can leave with fresh beer/wine and/or crowlers to go.
Nice place for a drink or meal right in falls church.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff, so come here for wine and they’ll set you up.  Beer garden in back omg!

This place is so cute! Theres craft beers downstairs for sell, upstairs is so cozy in the restaurant, outside are additional seating in the beer garden. The menu is affordable and I can say the chef is amazing. I started with chili and ended with a shrimp salad. I'm not disappointed. They also brunch on the weekend. It ends at 2pm.The location is great,It's right off 66, if you are va and want to explore a new menu. Check out Dominion Wine and Beer. It's definitely a hidden gem.

I ordered the Chicken Sandwich with provolone. I don't think there was even cheese on it. It was alright - I was hungry so it passed the test at the time. Also ordered the plantains, which were very good! I probably would not order from this place again. If I could do it over, I would have only had the sides.

I got the Italiano sandwich with a side of potato salad. The sandwich was small, undercooked meat, and quite dry. The potato salad was very unusual, had more carrots, peas, and other various elements than potatoes and was very dry. Overall I'm not very satisfied, and likely wouldn't return
Great prices and fast service! They're open for sure for pick up and delivery.  We ordered the Family meal, a whole chicken with 3 sides. It was more than enough for 5 people.

Started with bad service, had to ask for sauces. The chicken was okay, but the beans and rice had no flavor...BUT THE WORST was the Yuca was not cooked. Had to deep fry them to eat them. Awful, will not be back. With all the available chicken places I do not see how this one stays open.

It was little hard to find initially as it was at the roundabout of the corner. But food was Prepared quick & very well-cooked. Would go again. Best Crisp and Juicy experience was had at this location out of all.
The manager was rude and inconsiderate. She also had no manners and the smoothies tasted very bad. You are wasting your money on this place I don’t recommend.

I go to this place three or four times a week simply because it’s delicious natural best ingredients and best toppings in terms of healthy and natural and every time I go with a new friend and the new friends start having the same habit of going there every week as well
The acai bowl I bought was good but way overpriced for the amount that I received.

After a long day and workout I came by to get a protein smoothie and the smoothies never disappoint! The worker Franco was also very nice, fast, and can really make a smoothie, I will definitely be coming back very soon!

Robeks reimagined.   Under brand new management and a fresh look this Robeks is the place to be in Falls Church. The staff is really outgoing and friendly and of course they ever got the best smoothies and açai bowls and fresh juices in the entire area.  It’s comfortable to sit down here and enjoy what you just got or grab it and go.

Cozy ambiance, nice staff and good food.
The pad thai was one of the best I’ve had in DMV, and the red curry was also a great treatment.

The other menu items were decent and the portions a bit below what I’ve had at other restaurants. We ordered one dish per person and shared and were left scraping the (paper) plates down as the portions were felt a bit on the smaller end. Easy parking.

Four stars as I would recommend trying if you’re nearby.

We love sweet rice! It's the best for take out or dine in. The portions are generous dining in! We love the pad thai, green curry fried rice, lo mein and especially the ped-kapow-krob (the best thing on the menu!)

The hidden gem in Falls Church. Heading Eastbound on Route 7 (remember the 25 mph speed limit) Sweet Rice is just past Beyer Volvo on the right hand side. Parking for about ten cars - it sits next to a CBD store.

Lovely little Thai Eatery with truly exceptional service, excellent food and out of this world, super fresh Jasmine and Green Tea.

Every meal I've eaten there has been excellent with friendly service.

While dining, I  noticed quite a few people picking up take-out orders - I expect that they have a healthy take-out business.

All in all, very positive.

Sadly mediocre. I was the only patron during my entire visit (there was one other takeout order).

Summer Rolls were largely flavorless, with a slightly unpleasant sauce.  Crab Rangoon was passable, with a good ratio of pastry to filling but only average flavor.

Crispy Pork Belly had a tasty, spicy sauce, but the pork was chewy instead of crispy.

All prices charged were higher than those printed on menu. Will not return again.
It's a nice and clean place with good food.

Literally just found a mini cockroach in my drink. This mcdonalds needs some help.

I just went in and gave the drink back to your location. 10:32 a.m. on your cameras. The bug is on top. Of the cup.

I have pictures from when I found it and I have camera footage (as I work in a store) from when I slurped the thing up.

I've not ever had issues with mcdonalds before, this is wild.

Update, today is the 24th and I still have not been contacted about the situation.
I ordered 2 frapicionos without caramel and I got choclate instead and the staff were just gossiping. The most terrible service I've ever had from McDonalds.

I haven't been to Mc D's in probably 10 years. I caught word of a fresh all beef patty on the qpc so I had to give it a shot. All in all it was good. Not gourmet good. Not even 5 Guys good. But way better than the burger I remember it to be. This establishment is newly renovated. It has a nice layout and is very clean. The self service order screen is a neat addition.

Never written a negative review in my life but this is my half burnt bacon, egg and cheese McGriddle, When I ordered a sausage. My “Large” OJ Wasn’t even filled all the way and I only got one of the two extra hash browns. One issue things happen I get it but this isn’t an awesome way to start the day.
This location is worst in providing service for a curb side pick up. Takes min 10 to 15 mins to get a order to your car, doesn’t matter the either big or small. They takes their Own sweet time.

I went to this location and ordered a med salad, ask for extra dressing. The staff was very rude, held conversations in Spanish, laughing and smerking. I got the impression they did not want to serve me.

They bring the food to the table. With metal forks and knives. I recommend they also get sturdy dine-in bowls. Clean setting. Polite staff. They ask how the food is, as servers do at full service restaurants. Gets quite busy in the evenings. Gluten-free pasta option. Tofu option. Good family spot. Booths and one large circular table. Outdoor seating in contemporary shopping plaza.

We stopped here for dinner and were really impressed with the friendly staff. They were very pleasant at the time of ordering, and we saw them cleaning up after little ones that threw some food on the floor while the mom was trying to get them into their coats. While we were eating, two people came by to ensured our meals were what we were expecting. The food came out quickly, and was very hot which was what we were anticipating on a cold evening. I had the Japanese noodle bowl with steak - nice flavor with some spicy heat, but not too much. It was a much improved experience from other times we have visited this location, and we will definitely be back.

Exactly what you'd expect from the name.  I received piping hot noodles with the orange grilled chicken. I ordered the small portion for $8.00 and it was just the right amount for me.  If you like Asian noodles at reasonable prices this is a great choice. The fresh brewed unsweetened iced tea was delicious too. I was greeted by friendly staff behind the counter upon arrival. It was a very pleasant lunch. Will definitely be back.
Good food and service. They keep it nice and cool in warm weather. They do not cut corners on AC.

name: CM Chicken - Falls Church
vicinity: 7121 Leesburg Pike Unit B, Falls Church

reviews.text:
Let me preface this by saying I love wings.

And these were perfectly adequate wings. I got the lunch special, 5 wings with french fries, it's a deal I would get again. For the price, not bad.Flavorful (albeit not a flavor I liked) and moist yet crunchy on the outside. Objectively, these were wings in fine form. Medium to small size.

The flavor I picked was garlic spicy but a more accurate description would have been General Tso.

Ordered online. Service was quick and fast. Place was clean. I have no real complaints but to me, this was 3 star food. It was fine and the price was fair. Nothing to dream big about.

The online menu wasn't clear about how many pieces of chicken come in a order, so I called to ask. Good thing I did because they had a special offering a whole chicken (cut up) that was cheaper, for $23.99, plus free drumsticks. Sorry, can't remember how many pieces are standard, otherwise.

The chicken is so crispy and goes great with the snow onion sauce!

I want to say that the place is quite small probably only 4 to 5 tables to eat at . Very clean and organized. Guy at the counter Very helpful and polite. They have a  decent amount of things on the menu.  I order 5 wing combo with fries and  coleslaw. Lunch special for $9.99 which is a decent price  and it comes  with a  water or a soda. Chicken was good I would give it 3 and a half stars out of five. They needed a little more flavor. Fries where good just the way I like them only thing I  shouldn't have waited to get home to eat them, they lose a little of  their crunch. Also got some garlic soy chicken pretty good. I asked for regular and I don't know if  they were regular or spicy but they definitely had a  kick to them. It could be me though, I don't eat alot of spicy so for me it could be spicy and for you not so much also I'm not a coleslaw fan but it was pretty good I ate all of it.

The soy garlic was crispy and delicious, but the regular spicy too sticky sweet.  They have a promotion for a free order of drumsticks with the order of a whole chicken.  Plenty of food for 4, and comes with pickled radish cubes.

Edit
I ordered through delivery app and it was terrible. I think their sauce recipes got changed (downgraded). It's not what it used to taste like. Chicken quality dropped and sauce tastes dropped. After two bites of the chickens i ordered, i had to trash them all. It's so disappointing because CM chicken was my favorite and was better than bbq, bonchon, and pelicana. Now it's the worst.
